page.title: 17BOARDING SCHOOL LIFE
page.content: AS A BOARDER MY LIFE FOLLOWS A SET ROUTINE.ON WEEKDAYS THE MATRONS WAKE US AT 7.20AM AND WE WASH,DRESS AND GO DOWN TO BREAKFAST AT 8AM;I USUALLY HAVE TOAST AND CEREAL.BY 9AM WE HAVE TO MAKE OUR BEDS AND SORT OUT OUR BOOKS FOR THE DAYS' LESSONS AND THEN WE GO TO ASSEMBLY.LESSONS START AT 9.15AM AND LAST FOR 40 MINUTES EACH. THERE ARE EIGHT LESSONS IN A DAY. BREAK IS FROM 11.15-11.40AM WHEN WE HAVE A DRINK AND BISCUITS.AT 1PM WE LINE UP IN HOUSES BEFORE GOING INTO LUNCH.WE SIT IN PATROLS OF ABOUT EIGHT GIRLS AND MOVE TO A DIFFERENT TABLE EACH WEEK.WHEN WE LEAVE THE DINING HALL WE HAVE HALF AN HOUR'S FREE TIME BEFORE THE THREE AFTERNOON LESSONS. THESE END AT 4PM WHEN WE CAN HAVE TEA. AT 5PM PREP BEGINS AND LASTS UNTIL 7PM WHEN WE HAVE SUPPER.AFTER THAT WE ARE FREE UNTIL BEDTIME WHICH VARIES FROM
